intro: Pentanisia suffruticosa, commonly known as the red-flowered sandmat, is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub native to arid regions of North America. It is characterized by its woody stems and small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces clusters of bright red flowers, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its root system is extensive, allowing it to thrive in sandy or rocky soils. Pentanisia suffruticosa plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for desert wildlife.
